user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of process_param__threads:
```c
static enum PerfRepl_param_result
process_param__threads (const char *param_name, const char *param_tail,
                        const char *next_param)
{
  unsigned int param_value;
  enum PerfRepl_param_result value_res;

  if (tool_params.all_cpus)
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "Parameter '%s' cannot be used together "
             "with '-A' or '--all-cpus'.\n", param_name);
    return PERF_RPL_PARAM_ERROR;
  }
  if (tool_params.thread_per_conn)
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "Parameter '%s' cannot be used together "
             "with '-P' or '--thread-per-conn'.\n", param_name);
    return PERF_RPL_PARAM_ERROR;
  }
  value_res = get_param_value (param_name, param_tail, next_param,
                               &param_value);
  if (PERF_RPL_PARAM_ERROR == value_res)
    return value_res;

  if (0 == param_value)
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "'0' is not valid value for parameter '%s'.\n",
             param_name);
    return PERF_RPL_PARAM_ERROR;
  }
  tool_params.threads = param_value;
  return value_res;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function process_param__threads:
static enum PerfRepl_param_result
get_param_value (const char *param_name, const char *param_tail,
                 const char *next_param, unsigned int *param_value)
{
  const char *value_str;
  size_t digits;
  if (0 != param_tail[0])
  {
    if ('=' != param_tail[0])
      value_str = param_tail;
    else
      value_str = param_tail + 1;
  }
  else
    value_str = next_param;

  if (NULL != value_str)
    digits = mhd_tool_str_to_uint (value_str, param_value);
  else
    digits = 0;

  if ((0 == digits) || (0 != value_str[digits]))
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "Parameter '%s' is not followed by valid number.\n",
             param_name);
    return PERF_RPL_PARAM_ERROR;
  }

  if (0 != param_tail[0])
    return PERF_RPL_PARAM_FULL_STR;

  return PERF_RPL_PARAM_STR_PLUS_NEXT;
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
  value_res = get_param_value (param_name, param_tail, next_param,
                               &param_value);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: process_param__threads calls get_param_value. The provided get_param_value implementation does not call process_param__threads (it only calls mhd_tool_str_to_uint and uses fprintf and returns), and there is no indication of any other function in the call chain calling back. Therefore there is no direct or indirect recursion.
